abstract: Technicolor, century-old company that created full color film process utilized in 1939 movie Wizard of Oz, is subject of new book and film series; James Layton’s tome, The Dawn of Technicolor, 1915-1935, outlines company’s history perfecting method that started with just two-colors and its widespread use; Museum of Modern Art exhibit offers rare opportunity to see sampling of Technicolor flicks on original celluloid.
lead_paragraph: A recent book and a film series at the Museum of Modern Art explores the contributions Technicolor made to filmmaking.

headline.main: Technicolor at 100: Saturation and Subtlety in Filmmaking
headline.print_headline: Because No One Follows Just a Brick Road

snippet: A recent book and a film series at the Museum of Modern Art explores the contributions Technicolor made to filmmaking.
